title: Champion mastery 6 & 7 make no sense.
body:
http://i.imgur.com/TIBwHmM.png

Considering Hextech Chests are more common than keys for whatever reason. This seems more like a money grabber then actually being skilled with your champion. Lower the price on Blue Essence good god 500 is ridiculous.

replies.body: They want you to buy more keys/chest, basically just another cash grab. Dont fall for it!!!

yeah man what a cash grab
you can earn cool things for your character for free and don't have to pay anything, what a bunch of jews

The amount of keys to chests is almost always disproportional and essence costs are high. If you really want to be unlocking things with hextech they expect you to be paying which is where the cash grab comes in. They wouldn't have implemented this system if they didn't think it would increase their profits.

i've gotten around 4 - 5 free skins without paying anything, get more than enough key fragments, and i've even gotten a free champion. if you don't get anything i don't know what to tell you lol

of course it's going to try and "increase their profits"
riot is a business
it's kind of what they have to do to, you know, _be a business_

yes obviously they are a business, but just because they are a business doesn't somehow make it less of a cash grab. And this is supposed to be based around skill on a champion, so tying it into something that requires money doesn't make much sense.

"tying it into something that requires money" .... The only thing that it "requires" is that you play. I don't think you understand what a requirement is. You can now get things for free via a method that did NOT exist 6 months ago, or a year ago, or two years ago, or in beta, or at any point in the game's life. Riot Games has no reason to give you anything for free. They don't owe you anything. You play a free game. This is based far more around skill than money, but they also want it to be somewhat exclusive, unlike tier 5 which you can get after 20 good games. I have tier 5 on around 10 champions. 5 of them I suck at. i just happened to play them enough to get tier 5. I've even gotten an S on a champion or two that I suck at. 

I realize that using my personal experience to back up my own point is bad etiquette, so let's look at it another way. If you play 2 games a day, then you likely get your new chests as soon as they are available, or 1/week. It may be less likely if the person in question never ever plays with a group, but I find that unlikely. Now the only hinge is keys. According to Socrates on reddit, the average player earns 4 keys (12 fragment) in a month. https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/476v2l/what_i_learned_about_hextech_crafting_in_10_days/d0apufq

So the average player can open 4 chests a month. If getting any given item from hextech crafting is equally likely, which I will assume because it is more beneficial to you than me, and I can't find any data on the distribution, then about 1/5 of the time you will get a champ shard, on average worth 300 essence, meaning that on average, if you can all of your champ shards for essence, it will take  near 2 months to get the essence needed. However, I have 6 champ shards, and I've only bought 1 chest since hextech crafting began, which means that it's probably NOT equally likely to get any item, but that's merely anecdotal. 

In summation, the average player, without purchasing anything should be able to rank a champion past mastery level 5 on average 2 times every 3 months or so, barring they randomly happen to get a shard for the desired champion, for completely free. 

Does this still feel more like a money grab more than anything else that it could be?

You're my hero. You literally have said everything that I've been saying to people since Hextech Crafting and the original Mastery 6/7 were suggested.

I don't get why people can't wrap their heads around this idea. It's like they would rather immediately reject it like it's cancer instead of look at it from a different angle and see the HUGE benefit this brings.

For me personally I love the idea that over time you can unlock things that typically cost money for free.

However specifically for increasing your mastery with a champion, this system doesn't make sense. In order for you to upgrade your champion's mastery, you have to get more chests. But you can only get 1 chest per champion. So say you were a 1 trick, you'd be a master of that champion, but can't get the "mastery" of that champion until you play a good game with another champion. That's my issue with it.

"We’re adding a new mystery champ item to the store for RP or IP in a future patch that’ll help offset the RNG of finding champ shards and permanents in chests" - Rito

TL:DR - 1-trick = do well with champ. Which = wins. Wins = IP. IP = Free mystery champs. Which = lvl 7 for free.

>The only thing that it "requires" is that you play. 

You almost have it right.

"The only thing that it "requires" is that you play... and wait.
Wait.  Wait for chests to be available, wait for key fragments to arbitrarily drop, wait to get the contrived amount to unlock the chest, wait to get the right shard. Wait to get even more fragments for more chests so you can get enough to disenchant for enough essence.  
Riot was making such progress by getting rid of shit like the _Rune Combiner._  And doing that was great!

https://assets.vg247.com/current//2014/02/Dungeon_keeper.jpg
But then they make this system which uses the worst methods of modern games, pitting your time against your money, withholding content for no purpose other than to wear you out into paying, and sprinkling in gambling bait.  The kind of thing that is used by the slimiest of psychologically manipulative excuses for games.  This is what people have a problem with.
  Remember _Dungeon Keeper Mobile?_

And the thing is... no matter how blatant all this is, people will be ignore that and even put faith in this because of a few bucks worth of content, that they _maybe_ will get, that have been tossed out as a come-on.  And that's no problem, because even if giving you that $5 skin cost them anything at all (and it doesn't), that small cost things given to people who don't buy chests is well worth it.
Because they aren't the target, these sort of systems have been designed to target people who will spend $500 dollars using the [psychological techniques](http://search.proquest.com/openview/42d32456086b5eedd7f8aa8159beaf5a/1?pq-origsite=gscholar) that casinos use to exploit gambling addicts.

The one and only problem I have with rank 6 or 7 is that they require you to get an S rank in the games to unlock it. If I add up ALL of my games from this season the number of times I got an S rank was........once. And that was after going 27/5/3 as Rengar. I've gone 14/1/10 as Vel'koz but look I get an A- because I didn't have enough farm.  If they didn't make it so difficult to get S ranks I wouldn't have any issue.

So Rank 6 and 7 actually require demonstrating some skill, and that's bad?
It's the fact that there isn't a consistent "this is what increases/decreases your grade" so you don't actually know what you need to do to improve.

yeah, but sometimes the amount of "skill" they expect you display is really weird. take, for example, my attempts to get mastery tokens for Soraka yesterday/earlier today.
i played four games as Soraka support, and got one token, for the three games i remember vividly my ranks were S-, A, B+. my KDA (cs) for those same games, in the same order, were 1/6/23 (29?), 1/1/10 (9), 3/0/16 (11?) (those CS values may be wrong, but they're definitely close).
the games also DECREASED in duration as follows: 38 mins, 29 mins, 28 mins.
my warding was pretty constant through out, with more wards (about 10) for the first game (the longer), and a few more for the third game example.

all in all, this means my performance _improved_ over the course of these games, however my grade went down for each. *that* is what i think is the problem here.

Problem is that i need key fragments and they not seem to drop ever anymore (since about 6 weeks). I also dont have many LoL friends to play with to increase my droprate so im kinda forced to buy keys. Been stuck on 2 for 6 weeks now.

The lesson is main champions more often, get good with said champions. Party up with friends, get high rating with said champions consistently. Profit.

The system is a bit of a cash grab, but it also rewards certain 'styles' of playing the game more than others. I also think the 'style' it pushes people towards is very intentional. It's a great system... it rewards players for really 'sinking' into a particular champion and learning it, getting connected with it. This helps newer players be less punished and learn the game. I don't know -how- many bronze accounts you have to look at before you realize these people play any champion, any game, wether or not they know how to play them. This incentives people to not do these sort of things, thus hopefully levelling up overall level of play some over time.

agreed. that's what the stupid annie skin is all about too. It's appealing because no one has it, 

besides particles thouhg, ugly skin imo

What does not make sense either is that you have to basically play other champions than the one you are mastering in order to obtain levels 6 and 7 (right now the tokens weren't shipped in this patch because of last-minute issues, sounds familiar to dynamic/solo queue). Isn't the point of champion mastery is to show that you alone had played the champion in question above and beyond the average player? 

Look, we understand that Riot Games is a business that delivers a free-to-play game where we can choose whether to pay for incentives that come along with it or not, it is ultimately our choice. However, it isn't right to tie in money purchases with a system that is based around skill and dedication to a champion alone. That just ruins the integrity and sincerity of a system that is suppose to gauge anyone's determination of playing their champion if it can be done quicker with money. Not only that, **but for the next two weeks**, I'm going to still be stuck on mastery level 5 of the champion that I only truely love unless I cough up the dough for some RNG crates.

One trick ponies were slapped in the face today if they weren't lucky enough to have some blue essence or even a champion shard, which effectively makes them **paywalled**. We can't play other champions in order to get more crates since that destroys our character and relationship of the champion we so deeply like. Tokens that can be bought with IP, an essential F2P mechanic, weren't launched either.  Hopefully, Riot might fix in those tokens if they sincerely care enough.

I absolutely love that you need to get S ranks to get the mastery tokens, on that front mastery is actually skill based instead of just a measure on how much you play a champ like levels 1-5 are. Too bad they ruined it by tying it to the crafting. Hopefully they don't go full money-grab and sell the champ shards in the shop for RP only~~, which is apparently a possiblity. ~~

At first I thought the Hextech system would be made especially for veterans, than there were champion shards with fucked up everything, and the fact that the more key you drop the less you have chance to drop another one, which means you drop your first 4 keys at each start of a month and than, if you're lucky or **playing a lot** drop another one or two during the month...

That's just how I feel... needed to put it out there even if I know it  won't change anything ...

Threadly reminder that Treeline and ARAM still don't have Champion Mastery. Riot hasn't even announced a rough timeframe for it, as RGM modes somehow have priority. Players can demonstrate skill and dedication in temporary modes like URF or Poro King, but not in ranked TT.

It's really quite easy

Once you get to lvl 5 mastery you have a chance to earn tokens with that champion when you play with s- or better. But you can only get a token on mondays or thursdays between 3pm-5pm Pacific time. Other wise you can wait for the 2nd tuesday of the month between 9am-11am. Once you get your 2 tokens you pay $10 worth of RP to get the dust you need, OR you can try to raffle your way with a champ shard by spending RP for chests/keys. The chances of winning what you want go up 4% on Wednesdays but only if you purchase RP from the ingame store. If you purhcase RP from a gamestore you have to wait until thursday for only a 2.5% increased chance.

After this you need to play an ARAM game and win that game with that champion under 20 minutes and only dying 5 or less times. Once you acheive this you get mastery 6.

Then all you have to do is win more games at S or better with that champ in ranked games where you are solo Q and your teammates are 4 man. If you can win those games without getting a report you go into the RIOT-RAFFLE(tm) where you have a chance to win a token. After you collect enough tokens you need to Uninstall the game and stop playing because who really gives a shit about this stupid pointless mastery system?
